page.title: 04Lea Wood Hall
page.content: The construction of Lea Wood Hall was begun in 1870 and completed in 1874, being designed by the architect Nezfield. It was originally built for William Walker who owned factory next to John Smedley's (wool factory) which made army hats for the Crimean War. The hall stands in approximately eight acres of land. Lea Wood Hall is built from{Derbyshire Sand Stone.}It was originally built as a house with twenty rooms in it. At the moment the hall is owned by Mr. and Mrs. Green. They say they enjoy living in the hall because it is spacious and away from the hustle and bustle of every day life. They also like the attractive views over the fields that it stands in. The house next door was originally built as the hall's coach house.
